breaking_changes.description: SMT (Subscription Management Tool) has been removed and replaced by RMT. This change affects systems that were using SMT for repository management, as RMT requires different configuration and usage patterns. Existing setups relying on SMT will break as they will not be able to manage repositories or register systems without migrating to RMT.

389 Directory Server replaces OpenLDAP as the LDAP directory service. Existing Kubernetes workloads that depend on OpenLDAP for authentication or directory services will fail to function as expected after the upgrade, requiring migration to 389 Directory Server.

The glibc package has been updated to version 2.38, which introduces changes in memory management and threading behavior. Applications built against older versions may experience compatibility issues, particularly those that rely on specific memory allocation patterns.

mitigation_steps.action: Migrate from SMT to RMT by configuring RMT according to the documentation. Use 'zypper install rmt' to install RMT and follow the setup instructions in /usr/share/doc/rmt/README.

Migrate LDAP configurations from OpenLDAP to 389 Directory Server by exporting data from OpenLDAP and importing it into 389 Directory Server. Update Kubernetes configurations to point to the new directory server.
Test applications for compatibility with glibc 2.38. Rebuild any applications that may have compatibility issues with the new glibc version.

recommendations: Plan for a thorough testing phase post-upgrade to identify any compatibility issues with existing Kubernetes workloads.
Ensure that all Kubernetes components are compatible with the new versions of system libraries and services introduced in SLES 15 SP7.
